programme.title: The New Heroic Picture of Thomas Andrews
programme.desc: Every film and every documentary show Thomas Andrews at the end in the first-class smoking room in front of the fireplace staring up at a painting. Kent Layton and his co-authors have uncovered sources that give us a very different account of Mr....

programme.title: What did Marine Superintendent James McGiffin Know?
programme.desc: Why was White Star’s Marine Superintendent at Queenstown never called to give evidence to the British inquiry? After all, he was one of the last White Star representatives to step off Titanic before she sailed. Is this evidence that the inquiry was...

programme.title: Remembering Eva Hart
programme.desc: Charles Haas reflects on his friend, Titanic survivor Eva Hart, in an emotional never before told story of their last encounter and Eva’s surprising change of heart about recovering artifacts.

programme.title: Matching Shoes What Else Can That Be?
programme.desc: Ken Marschall, who’s been to the Titanic wreck six times, remembers standing at the door of Robert Ballard’s office and telling him, “I’ve found the bodies...”

programme.title: Shipwreck Diving
programme.desc: With the recent discovery of the German submarine in the North Sea, we decided to go into the archives and take another look at Richie Kohler’s Shipwreck Diving. In this remarkable episode, Richie tells of his own extraordinary discovery of a World...

programme.title: The Mirage Theory
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson gives us a clear and thorough explanation of the Mirage Theory. Does this theory really explain why Titanic hit the iceberg?

programme.title: Britannic Dive Part 2
programme.desc: For underwater explorers, the 400-foot dive to Britannic is at the apex of technical diving. Richie Kohler relates his harrowing life and death experience on Britannic in 2009.

programme.title: Submarine Signals
programme.desc: In 1912, the greatest threat to shipping was not ice - it was fog. Bill Sauder explains how submarine signaling helped navigate ships like Titanic through treacherous waters.

programme.title: Did the Lights Stay On?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson introduces an eyewitness account who says that the lights stayed on in the aft part of Titanic after she broke! Parks also explains how this could have happened.

programme.title: Fixing The Wireless
programme.desc: If Jack Phillips had followed the rules, the wireless set would have still been broken the night the Titanic hit the iceberg and the Carpathia may never have received the distress call in time. Instead, Jack took initiative and fixed it himself and...

programme.title: Titanic's First-Class Lounge
programme.desc: What did you do in Titanic’s First Class Lounge? Well oddly enough you didn’t lounge, corsets and celluloid collars prevented that! Bill Sauder gives us a look at what went on inside Titanic’s magnificent lounge for the rich and famous.

programme.title: The Padded Room
programme.desc: Hidden away in Titanic’s isolation hospital was a 5x6 room padded completely from top to bottom with canvas cushions. White Star didn’t talk much about the room, but Bill Sauder will tell you how it was used.

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: Wrought Iron Gates on D Deck
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: Did Titanic Have Inferior Steel?
programme.desc: It’s been a theory talked about for years; were the rivets and steel used in Titanic inferior? Parks looks at the science of the debate and very well may put an end to the controversy.

programme.title: Two Bath Tubs
programme.desc: There were only two bathtubs for all 709 Third Class passengers aboard Titanic. Sauder explains why probably no one in Third Class complained!

programme.title: An Experience of A Lifetime Diving Titanic
programme.desc: He was the first school teacher to dive Titanic, not once - but twice. In this very candid account, Titanic channel host Charles Haas tells us how nerves almost kept him from going. In the end, his journey to his beloved Titanic proved to be an exciting...

programme.title: The Padded Room
programme.desc: Hidden away in Titanic’s isolation hospital was a 5x6 room padded completely from top to bottom with canvas cushions. White Star didn’t talk much about the room, but Bill Sauder will tell you how it was used.

programme.title: Photographing Titanic
programme.desc: We have so few photographs of Titanic. Collector, Craig Sopin, believes there may be more out there, possibly even in the debris ﬁeld. In this episode, he gives us a rare glimpse of workers photographed on the grand staircase.

programme.title: Goodbye Old Man
programme.desc: These incredible words written by the most senior surviving officer of the Titanic, gives us a rare and historic glimpse of the final moments of the senior men that night. It may surprise you to hear just how calm these men really were.

programme.title: Kicking the Tires
programme.desc: It’s always been debated how much influence Bruce Ismay had on Captain Smith’s operation of the ship on her fateful voyage. Senan Molony gives us a look at a rare photo that may offer some answers.

programme.title: Archibald Gracie’s Last Letter
programme.desc: Host Andrew Aldridge reveals a remarkable letter written by Archibald Gracie barely eight weeks before he died. It was written to fellow Carpathia passenger Louis Ogden, who was responsible for some of the iconic photographs taken of Titanic survivors...

programme.title: The Lost Documents of Titanic: The Log Books
programme.desc: What could the log books from the Titanic and the Californian tell us today? Would they shed any light on the operations of either ship that night? In part one of this two-part series, Titanic Channel Host and author Charles Haas speculates what we might...

programme.title: Rescuing the Telegrams
programme.desc: Charles Haas shares the remarkable story of how priceless pieces of Titanic history were rescued before they were almost lost forever from a dumpster in New York City.

programme.title: The Hazards of First-Class Travel
programme.desc: Traveling first-class on Titanic was certainly luxurious. Most of the passengers were very pleasant and the food was good, but you had to be careful about letting your guard down. Titanic Channel Host Bill Sauder reveals the very real dangers of...

programme.title: Titanic's Second Class Carnage
programme.desc: Senan Molony calls the second class, “the forgotten class.” The men suffered, “absolute carnage,” they didn’t have a chance! Senan gives us a sobering look at what it was like as a second-class passenger the night Titanic sank.

programme.title: Super League Triathlon Arena Games 2023 London Men
programme.desc: Gustav Iden, Henri Schoeman and Kyle Smith all line up in the same heat at Arena Games Triathlon London. How will Gustav fare in his Arena Games Triathlon powered by Zwift debut? Who’s ready to watch the pros battle it out to be crowned the triathlon esports World Champion?

programme.title: Golden Trail World Series 2023 - USA (Eng)
programme.desc: For the two last stages before the final, the GTWS visits the USA! Follow the best trail running athletes on the US trails. Enter their life during this road trip through the western part of the USA and watch them competing on the two last races of the season - Pikes Peak Ascent and Mammoth Lakes 26K. Who will get qualified for the Grand Final in Italy? Lets see!

programme.title: Marathon des Sables Fuerteventura 2024 (Eng)
programme.desc: Welcome to the Fuerteventura Sand Marathon Edition 2024, on the second largest Canary Island off the coast of Africa and theMorocco, land of origin of the MDS. 300 runners from 25 nationalities took on the 3 stages of this course with 3 distances to choose from: 70, 100 or 120km. An extraordinary human adventure in breathtaking landscapes.

programme.title: The First Second - Gediminas Grinius
programme.desc: Running with Gediminas means exploring the mental techniques hes continuously developing to both cope with pain and get on the podiums of the worlds most difficult ultra-trails. Or how a Lithuanian veteran of the Iraq War turned weakness and trauma into personal progress by running with his mind!

programme.title: Ungrounded Episode 1 - Caroline Gleich
programme.desc: Caroline Gleich, a world class ski mountaineer, summited Mt. Everest last spring as part of her #ClimbForEquality campaign to raise awareness for gender equality. In Episode 1, Gleich overcomes her own struggle after tearing her ACL to rise to the top for all women. (English version with French, Italian, German and Spanish subtitles available)

programme.title: The First Second - Laetitia-roux
programme.desc: Championne de France la plus titrée de tous les temps, Laetitia Roux a une capacité presque irréelle à relever des défis dans lun des sports les plus difficiles. Sa formation peut être une école de la vie. Son esprit naturel de compétition solo se transforme en travail déquipe et en partage. Avec le ski alpinisme, vous la voyez dans son élément : haute, vive, rapide et amusante…..

programme.title: Maxi Race 2023
programme.desc: Le tOur du lac, (la MaXi Race 88 km / 5000 m D+), course reine du week-end, a livré un scénario haletant avec une course indécise jusqu’au bout. Au départ, à 2 h 50 du matin, ils étaient 1752 coureurs dont 158 femmes.

programme.title: Ungrounded Episode 4 - Sunny Stroeer
programme.desc: Two weeks after paying off her student loans, Sunny Stroeer left her job as a strategy consultant, moved into her astro van, and began running and climbing full time. Since then, she has gone to break records and climb summits no woman has done before. In Episode 4 of Ungrounded, Stroeer shares how she pushed herself to tackle some of the world’s highest peaks.(English version with French, German, Italian and Spanish subtitles available)

programme.title: Mongolia Horseback Archery World Championships 2023
programme.desc: For 2023, Mongolia and its capital Ulaanbaatar was brought in the spotlight of official horseback archery competition, that has grown a lot over the last few years in many places around the world. Everything started with the Spirit International HBA tournament in the beginning of September and this event would set the stage for the pinnacle one that was about to follow: the 2023 International Horse Archery Alliance World Championships.

programme.title: Funes Valley Winter Hike (Eng)
programme.desc: We take an amazing 12 km winter snow shoe hike through one of the most famous UNESCO heritage mountain locations in the heart of the Italian Dolomites- in the FUNES national park, at the base of the ODLE mountain range. Our path takes us to a mountain refuge and return in the dark.......

programme.title: Supertri 2025 Rd 3 Jersey Eng
programme.desc: Relive all the action from Supertri Jersey – where the world’s best triathletes went head-to-head in one of the most thrilling stops of the season. From explosive swims to lightning-fast transitions and epic sprints to the finish line, these highlights capture the intensity, drama, and excitement that define Supertri.

programme.title: Malawi Bike Tour Part 3
programme.desc: Il nostro amico bikepacker e avventuriero Michele è in viaggio di 4 settimane e 1400 km attraverso la savana, le montagne e le foreste del Malawi. Fantastica avventura africana, paesaggi meravigliosi, grandi incontri umani, fauna selvatica. Parte 3 di Liwonde N.P. a Blantyre.Our friend bikepacker and adventurer Michele is on a 4 weeks and 1400 km bike trip through savanna, mountains and forests in Malawi. Fantastic African adventure, gorgeous scenery, great human encounters, wildlife. Part 3 from Liwonde N.P. to Blantyre.

programme.title: Road To One Water Race Ep3 - Swimming
programme.desc: One Water Race is an endurance race based on Running, Swimming and Orienteering. 7 mixed teams of 7 athletes have to cross the Stockholm-Sweden archipelago from North to South in a non-stop 250 km race with 200 km of running and 50 km of swimming. They have to completely handle their navigation including in the darkness. Road to One Water Race Ep3 describes what is involved in swimming 50 km during the day and during the night in between Islands..

programme.title: Capraia Island Adventure Part 1 (Eng)
programme.desc: Round the wild untouched island of Capraia off the Tuscan coast of Italy on a small boat with an expert guide and up close to the coast to see the geologic and historical secrets of the island

programme.title: Madonna Di Campiglio Clip
programme.desc: Madonna Di Campiglio Clip

programme.title: The Outdoor Sports Show 2025 - Episode 8
programme.desc: We start this episode with DATEV Challenge Roth, the world-renowned, long-distance triathlon held annually in Bavaria, Germany. We then move to neighboring Austria for a unique cycling adventure, the Tour of Austria. Widely considered one of the most scenic marathons in Europe, TUI Palma Marathon celebrates its 21th anniversary on Sunday October 19th 2025. More challenges all over the world are lying ahead. OCEANMAN is the world’s largest open water swimming series. We then go to Aachen for the World Equestrian Festival and the Rolex Grand Prix. We finish in Germany with a true celebration of sports: the 2025 FISU World University Games Summer featuring around 8,500 student-athletes and officials from over 100 countries competing for medals in 18 sports.

programme.title: Elegance and innovative solutions
programme.desc: Welcome aboard the new Absolute 56 Fly, an elegant and refined boat with exceptional performance. The engine is Volvo Penta and two IPS 800s are mounted on this model.

programme.title: Galeon 480 FLY – New generation nautical luxury
programme.desc: The new Galeon 480 FLY, designed by Tony Castro, offers expanded spaces and natural light thanks to oversized windows. Flybridge with double relaxation area, wet bar and top helm station, Beach Mode with glass balconies and aft platform with retractable grill.

programme.title: Riva 82 Diva – It is indeed a ‘Diva’
programme.desc: The Riva 82’ Diva, a yacht built in Italy by world iconic shipyard Riva, flaunts its advanced new design and super structure with an attitude. It is a boat that fits perfectly with its name, a ‘Diva’.

programme.title: Midnight Express 52 Vitesse Versatility and comfort without compromise
programme.desc: The new 52’ Vitesse offers generous outdoor spaces and a cabin with suite, lounge, separate bathroom and children’s berth. Ideal for day cruising or extended weekends, it is fully customizable according to the owner’s needs.

programme.title: Pure fascination
programme.desc: Discover the Wally Better Place, 50 meters of pure fascination, with a great hull, designed by Bill Tripp. This incredible sailboat is the biggest sloop made of carbon ever built. The exterior is very innovative and so is the interior, with its very impressive spaces.

programme.title: Oceanis 37.1 First Line - Walkthrough
programme.desc: Hop-on board as Antonio Vettese walks us through a new ambitious boat from the Beneteau Group, Oceanis 37.1 First Line.

programme.title: Swan 55 - Alegher Eng
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese is on board the Swan 55 Alegher and he is ready to interview Vanni Galgani, Head of product Marketing of Nautors Swan.

programme.title: An habitability beyond its size
programme.desc: Discover the Sun Odyssey 410, built by Jeanneau and designed by Marc Lombard, the architect that defined the geometric and angular lines of this family cruiser. The habitability of this model goes beyond its size of 12 meters, assuring a pleasant sailing and living experience.

programme.title: Italia Yachts - The Shipyard
programme.desc: Our Bacci Del Buono takes you on an exclusive visit to the shipyard of Italia Yachts, a builder of high-quality sailboats located in Ostellato. How are they built? We have heard about the Sales Manager of the brand.

programme.title: Outremer 52 The interview
programme.desc: Hop on board the Outremer 52 for an exclusive interview with Matthieu Rougevin-Baville, Sales Director of Outremer Yachting.

programme.title: America's Cup: Road to Barcelona
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese is at the centro del villaggio che ospiterà la 37esima edizione dellAmericas Cup nel 2024.

programme.title: New requirements
programme.desc: Our Federico Maselli takes you to the southern part of the Venice Lagoon, to discover the ITA 14.99 by Itacatamarans, the shipyard’s first boat in the field of multihulls. This catamaran perfectly combines the style of Made in Italy with art and design, and fully meets the new market needs.

programme.title: Elan i43 - Boot 2023
programme.desc: The Boat Show is at the Boot di Düsseldorf to discover the new Elan i43, shown for the first time. Hop on board to find out more about this vessel.

programme.title: SF 400 - A small sailboat
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese is on board the SF 400, a sailboat designed for an ownerlover of the Gulf of Trieste and regattas. Built in Slovenia by Ocean Tec isoptimized for a light wind.

programme.title: Y Yachts Y7 - Easy sailing
programme.desc: The hull of the new Y Yachts 7 sailing yacht is technologically advanced but also simple in order to guarantee a pleasant and easy sailing.

programme.title: The Luna Rossa Prada Pirelli Team
programme.desc: For Patrizio Bertelli this is his 6th adventure at the American’s Cup, a goal that was never reached before. The 36th Americas Cup Match will be held in Auckland, New Zealand and the Luna Rossa Prada Pirelli Team is getting ready for the upcoming first event of the Prada Cup in Cagliari, Italy.

programme.title: Daysailers - Boot 2023 Eng
programme.desc: The Boat Show takes you on board the Daysailers of the moment, presented at the to the Boot in Düsseldorf. Find out these innovative boats with a Nordic soul.

programme.title: Leopard 40 Miami Boat Show 2024
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese presents the Leopard 40 Powercat, the smallest boat in the shipyards motor range. Despite its size, it maintains the DNA of its sisters, guaranteeing the same level of comfort and performance.

programme.title: Jeanneau Yachts 55 - Legacy of innovation 2
programme.desc: Marked as the most successful attempt of revolutionizing both inside and outside space of the boat, Jeanneau 55’s sail boat innovation put forward the ultimate comfort of the user.

programme.title: Solaris 60 Blue water ambitions
programme.desc: Hop on-board together with Antonio Vettese on the boat that become the emblem of blue water ambitions, Solaris 60, constructed in Italy by Solaris Yachts.

programme.title: Fountaine Pajot MY6 - St. Petersburg Boat Show 2024
programme.desc: Bill Hackett introduces the new luxury catamaran Fountaine Pajot MY6 at the 2024 St. Petersburg Boat Show. This model offers extraordinary performance, along with a huge and comfortable flybridge to spend the day.

programme.title: Allures 51.9 - The power of aluminum
programme.desc: Discover the beautiful Allures 51.9, the sailing boat of your dreams, built in aluminum and perfect to go around the world and visit any sea in any weather condition.

programme.title: 151 Miglia - Best of 2022 (Eng)
programme.desc: The Boat Show takes you to the best moments of the 13th edition of the 151 Miglia, Cetilar Trophy. With Bacci Del Buono aboard one of the largest and fastest boats, the Vismar 80.

programme.title: Ice Cup 2022 (ENG)
programme.desc: Welcome to the third edition of the Ice Cup, a coastal sailing trip organized by Ice Yachts for the owners of its fast cruisers. Get ready for an exciting weekend of regattas in the Gulf of Tigullio.

programme.title: Contest 50 CS - Boot 2023
programme.desc: Discover the Contest 50 CS, premiering at the Boot alongside its smaller sister. This beautiful bluewater is ideal for demanding navigation in the often stormy North Sea.

programme.title: Solaris Yachts - The Shipyards
programme.desc: Our Antonio Vettese brings you to Aquileia, for an exclusive visit inside the Solaris shipyard. Historically well-known as a sailboat manufacturer, has recently started building motorboats. Discover it with The Boat Show.

programme.title: When A Woman's Fed Up
programme.desc: Taryln is a powerful and career-driven woman with a high tolerance for her husbands foolishness. When she discovers that her man has been unfaithful, she hatches a devious plot to teach her "better half" a lesson he will never forget.

programme.title: Full Circle
programme.desc: A young pizza delivery boy, Anthoni, faces a life-changing crisis when his curiosity pulls him away from his delivery order into an adjacent apartments open door. He cannot resist the temptation when he stumbles across a large sum of money in the aftermath of what seems to be a drug deal gone bad. After taking the money his life is thrown into turmoil as everyone he knows and cares about is put in jeopardy. Anthonis focus turns to revenge when a close friend is killed for his actions. Anthoni goes on his comically charged journey for vengeance as outlandish characters banter through out in this musically infused, urban set comedy-action-drama. Anthoni is focused on avenging the death of his close friend even if it means going up against the neighborhoods most notorious thug, Lomatic.

programme.title: Black Butterfly
programme.desc: Black Butterfly is about 16 year old Ariel- a girl with a dream. Making the Womens U.S. Swim Team will change her life. Ariel excitedly begins training when... tragedy strikes. She is brutally raped. Her dreams of swimming, relationships, and life are tossed to and fro as she struggles within the aftermath. Should she tell? Should she hide? Adrenaline and anticipation rise as her coach, family and friends find out about the rape in various ways. Now, what will each do to seek revenge? How will they deal with a rapist who is no stranger to their lives? What draws the line between pain and possibility for Ariel?

programme.title: Eng 3 Apartment Fire Part 1
programme.desc: The crew of Engine 3s "A" Shift start their day with some of the best tacos in town, a call comes for a fire; the arrive on-scene to a mattress fire possibly set by a homeless person. Then a call comes in for a structure fire. They arrive on scene to a second floor apartment. Captain Palmer takes Command and his crew go into action. Firemen is Garcia on the pump panel, Firefighter Silva pulls the nozzle up the steps, and safely puts on his PPE and they head into the fire.Arson investigation arrives on scene. Back at the station, a quick bit of food, and another call comes in for a structure fire and the Palmer and the crew head out the door.

programme.title: Part 2 of 24 with Engine 3
programme.desc: Firefighter/engineer Chris Garcias family drops by for Easter Sunday. The guys are in the kitchen cooking up lunch, and a call comes and they are onto the rig. The Fire Company arrives at the scene to a shooting. The police had been in a pursuit of gang bangers in a black SUV. They find them and a shoot out occurs and the police shoot a suspect to a killing. Next up, a vehicle accident. Night falls and a call comes in for a commercial structure fire. Eng. 3s "A" Shift is 1st in on a Antique Store fire owned by a horder.

programme.title: Renaud Capuçon, Gerard Causse, Iddo Bar-Shai & Jean-Jacques Kantorow - Chamber music by Mozart and Shostakovich
programme.desc: French violinist Renaud Capuçon appears at the festival Les Coups de Cœur de Chantilly, presenting a chamber music program consisting of classical and 20th century repertoire. He performs with the soloists of the International Menuhin Music Academy led by French conductor Jean-Jacques Kantorow. First on the program is Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart’s Sinfonia Concertante in E-flat major, K. 364, in which Capuçon and violist Gérard Caussé appear as the soloists. Capuçon is then joined by pianist Iddo Bar-Shaï for a performance of Mozart’s Sonata for violin and piano in E minor, K. 304. The program closes with Dmitri Shostakovich’s Chamber Symphony in C minor, Op. 110a, which is a transcription of Shostakovich’s String Quartet No. 8 by Russian conductor Rudolf Barshai, the composer’s close friend. This performance was recorded at Château de Chantilly, on May 15, 2021.

programme.title: Kristof Barati - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Iván Fischer & Orchestra del Maggio Musicale Fiorentino - Mozart Symphony No. 34 & Dvořák Symphony No. 7
programme.desc: Maestro Iván Fischer leads the Orchestra del Maggio Musicale Fiorentino in a remarkable concert program of works by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart and Antonín Dvořák. Mozart’s Symphony No. 34 in C major, K. 338 opens the program. Completed in the summer of 1780, this was the last symphony Mozart wrote in Salzburg, where he worked as a court musician. The three-movement symphony features two vibrant outer movements with fanfares and rousing themes, while the quieter second movement is scored for strings alone, deviating from the typical four-movement structure of the time. Next on the program is Dvořák’s Symphony No. 7 in D minor, Op. 70, completed in March 1885 and premiered one month later in London conducted by the composer himself. With its dramatic and dark style, this symphony stands in stark contrast to the predominantly optimistic tone of Dvořák’s broader oeuvre. This performance was recorded at Teatro del Maggio Musicale Fiorentino in Florence, Italy, on January 29, 2021.

programme.title: Sir John Eliot Gardiner - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Adrien Perruchon, Symfonieorkest Vlaanderen & Josef Špaček - Works by Ravel, Lalo, Ginastera a. o.
programme.desc: French conductor Adrien Perruchon and the Flanders Symphony Orchestra take us on a musical journey to Argentine, Spain, and Mexico, in this March 1, 2017 concert performance at Concertgebouw Brugge in Belgium. The program opens with Édouard Lalo’s Spanish Symphony for violin and orchestra, Op. 21, featuring Czech violinist Josef Špaček as the soloist. This is followed by Mathias Coppens’ Music for Orchestra, Op. 12. The program continues with Alberto Ginastera’s Dances from Estancia, Op. 8a, and Aaron Copland’s El Salón México. Also on the program is Maurice Ravel’s famous Boléro. The program comes to a close with Arturo Márquez’s Danzón No. 2.

programme.title: Wycliffe Gordon - Wynton Marsalis: In This House, on This Morning
programme.desc: The final concert of the Münchner Klaviersommer 1992 was by Wynton Marsalis and his septet. The 31-years-young star trumpeter performed one of his own jazz suites to the sold-out Philharmonie, under the title of ‘In This House, On This Morning’. The concert covers every jazz style, in composition and improvisation, and in both small and grand forms. Marsalis’s Septet was made up of Wess Anderson (alto saxophone), Wycliffe Gordon (trombone), Reginald Veal (bass), Herlin Riley (drums), Todd Williams (tenor saxophone), and Eric Reed (piano).

programme.title: Dizzy Gillespie, Tony Coe, Derek Humble & Billy Mitchell - Manteca
programme.desc: American jazz trumpeter, composer, and bandleader Dizzy Gillespie (1917-1993) was one of the seminal figures of the bebop movement. He fuses all musical forms rooted in African culture, such as music from Cuba, Latin America and the Caribbean, into his music. On November 4, 1970 he played a concert in Denmark with the Kenny Clarke/Francy Boland Big Band, performing Con Alma, Brother K, Now Hear My Meanin’, Manteca, Let Me Outta Here, and Things Are Here.

programme.title: Chet Baker - DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Charles Mingus, Jaki Byard, Dannie Richmond & Johnny Coles - Charles Mingus And Eric Dolphy live in Liège
programme.desc: Charles Mingus showcases an exceptional concert performed in April 1965 featuring his most celebrated lineup: Jaki Byard (piano), Dannie Richmond (drums), Johnny Coles (trumpet), Clifford Jordan (tenor sax) and the great Eric Dolphy (alto sax, flute and bass clarinet). Recorded within an eight-day span, less than three months before Dolphy's death, the three concerts showcase Mingus's visionary leadership and the band's incredible depth and diversity with unique performances and arrangements of classics including ‘So Long Eric’ and the groundbreaking ‘Meditations On Integration’.

programme.title: Lianne La Havas - Unstoppable
programme.desc: Lianne La Havas’ performance at Casino de Paris captures the British singer-songwriter at her best: with her crystalline voice she performs soulful melodies full of sincerity. The performance is part of La Havas’ 'Blood Tour', a concert tour promoting her second album 'Blood' (2015). She is accompanied by James Wyatt on keys, Adam Prendergast on bass, Giles King Ashong on drums, and Frida Touray on backing vocals.

programme.title: John Coltrane, McCoy Tyner, Elvin Jones & Jimmy Garrison - John Coltrane: Live in Comblain-la-Tour
programme.desc: The mere mention of the name John Coltrane evokes a deeply emotional, often spiritual response from even the most casual jazz fan. Dexter Gordon was a fantastic saxophonist. Miles Davis was a genius. Coltrane stood above - he was a visionary, a saint-like figure. By the standards of most jazz musicians, his life was uneventful. Sure, he had a heroin habit for a while, and Miles Davis punched him, but once he'd experienced the “spiritual awakening” described in the liner notes of his 1965 album A Love Supreme, he dedicated himself to his music with extreme single-mindedness. This broadcast of Coltrane's 1965 performance at the short-lived Belgian jazz festival in Comblain-la-Tour features Trane's classic quartet with Elvin Jones (drums), Jimmy Garrison (bass) and McCoy Tyner (piano).

programme.title: Morning Movers
programme.desc: Don’t miss the go-to resource for pre-market action from the floor of the New York Stock Exchange. Join Diane King Hall for breaking economic news, expert analysis, technical insights, and real-time trading strategies.

programme.title: Opening Bell
programme.desc: Opening Bell

programme.title: Morning Trade Live
programme.desc: Sam Vadas takes traders beyond the headlines with a sharp focus on the macro drivers, sector rotations, and global forces shaping the day’s market action. From breaking down U.S. and international economic data to analyzing sector performance and cross-asset moves, Morning Trade Live delivers the context traders need to understand the “why” behind early trading activity.

programme.title: Trading 360
programme.desc: After the dust settles from the opening bell, Trading 360 with Marley Kayden features Wall Street’s best traders, analysts and technicians to break down sectors and stocks moving markets. Trading 360 focuses on disruptive companies and new technologies driving market headlines while providing investors a 360-degree actionable approach to trading.

programme.title: Fast Market
programme.desc: Host Diane King Hall teams up with veteran traders Tom White and Kevin Hincks to break down live market moves and deliver actionable trade ideas in real time. From options strategies and volatility plays to earnings reactions, they bring in market specialists, analysts, and guests to give active traders the setups and strategies they can use right now.

programme.title: The Carl Jackson Podcast
programme.desc: Bill Maxwell

programme.title: CJC Family Music

programme.title: Immortal Soul
programme.desc: "Immortal Soul" is a 2022 drama film directed by Carl Jackson, about a couple whose love is tested by time and distance until they confront destiny. The film, based on Elijah Jackson's album of the same name, explores themes of the afterlife and premiered on March 25, 2022.

programme.title: World Poker Tour

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.desc: Four players remain at the final table of the World Poker Finals in Foxwoods.

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.desc: Local player, Rhode Island native, Bob Carbone faces off against two tough young poker pros, New Yorker Daniel Santoro and Marylander, former WPT Finalist, Christian Harder.

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.desc: Gus Hansen and Daniel Negreanu both fell short in their bid to win two Five Diamond titles on the WPT, and now reigning champion Antonio Esfandiari has found himself back at the final table

programme.title: World Poker Tour

programme.title: Animals
programme.desc: Pol is a teenager with a seemingly calm life. He lives with his brother, and is still in high school. However, Pol has a secret: Deerhoof, a cuddly teddy bear who thinks, moves around, and with whom he shares his best moments. Life goes on as normal until the arrival of Ikari, an enigmatic student who seems to be hiding something.

programme.title: UFA 326.328-329 - Bare Knuckle Boxing (BKB) 31
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Bare Knuckle Boxing 31 part 1 from London. Undefeated Jordan Tompkins from London faces Romanian Ionel Levitchi, Harvey Dossett takes on Danny Fletcher making his BKB debut, Patrick Nash takes on Corey Healey and Luke Smith steps in the ring with Liam Rees. United Fight Alliance presents Bare Knuckle Boxing 31 part 2 from London. George Hillyard faces Jack McLean, Jonny Lawson fights Martin Refell, UFC veteran Bradley Scott takes on reigning champion Ryan Barrett in a fight with the British Cruiserweight Title up for grabs. Also watch Callan Harley take on Jonny Jones in a five round title fight. United Fight Alliance presents Bare Knuckle Boxing 31 part 3 from London. In this episode Paul Hilz (5-5) faces Kearon Thomas making his BKB debut, Dan Chapman of Wales faces Tito Martins from Brazil and Dan Lerwell takes on Stuart Maddox in a British Middleweight title clash. In the Main Event with a World Lightweight Title on the line James Connelly takes on Marley Churcher in a 7 round match.

programme.title: "UFA 327 - Bash Boxing, MarvNation at Pechanga"
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Bash Boxing and MarvnNation Promotions at the Pechanga Resort Casino. In a southpaw against Southpaw match, Fernando Vargas Jr. (9-0) faces Heber Rondon (20-4). In the main event undefeated Jonathan Lopez (10-0) with 7 KOs takes on more the experienced Eduardo Baez (21-4).

programme.title: UFA 344 - Up Next Fighting (UNF) 8 - Wassmer vs. Lua
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Up Next Fighting 8 from Southern California. In this episode, Kester Abad faces Dylan Stockard in a flyweight bout and Daniel Labastida and Matheus Santos face off in a bantamweight contest. Also watch as David Babakhanyan takes on Daniel Gualajara and in the main event, Elwig Wassmer, defending title holder and a biochemist looks to take on Israel Lua (Ben Jones camp) with knockout power, in whats expected to be a combustible fight with two titles on the line. The fighters contend for both the UNF flyweight title and the California state championship title.

programme.title: UFA 337 - KOK Best Of part 1
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents KOK Best Of part 1. programme.title: The biodiversity of Dubai's shores has brought fly fishing to the Middle East for the first time
programme.desc: When most people think of fly fishing they think of being far out in the wilderness, away from civilisation, by a river or somewhere in the ocean. But Ocean Active Fly has re-imagined this scene - offering urban fly fishing right in the middle of Dubai. This is the first fly fishing operation in the Middle East. The founder, Nick Bowles, explained to Euronews why fishing there are fishing opportunities in Dubai: "Dubai’s built the biggest man-made reefs with the palm islands and that, so it’s created a huge habitat." Artificial reefs can lead to a quick increase in the local fish population. They draw plankton which smaller fish can prey on which then attracts bigger fish suitable for fly fishing. One species drawn to the artificial reefs in Dubai is the queenfish. They can grow to be over a metre long and up to 15 kilograms, although most are about half that weight. This kind of fish is particularly good for fly fishing because of its visual takes and the fact it swims in schools. Fly fishing differs from more conventional spin fishing. Instead of having a heavy lure at the end of the fishing line, fly fishers have a fly which is lighter and less likely to scare away game. The fly stays on the surface of the water where fish will be attracted to it, thinking it is prey. With ocean fly fishing youre constantly on the move to find the next school of fish "So you literally run - shoot, run - shoot." But the unique part of fly fishing in Dubai is the proximity to its skyline. Fly fishing is done close to the shore so anglers are surrounded by the citys landmarks.: the Burj Khalifa, the Burj Al Arab, Palm Jumeirah and Dubai Marina.

programme.title: Wuzhen
programme.desc: Come visit Wuzhen, a 1,300-year-old water town on the lower reaches of the Yangtze River. Located on the Hangzhou-Jiaxing-Huzhou Plain in northern Zhejiang Province, it isat the center of the golden triangle consisting of Shanghai, Hangzhou and Suzhou. The most famous of the six “watertowns” in China, Wuzhen is commonly called “the Venice of the East” so taking a boat ride through the towns storied canals is a must. If you are going to make a day out of it, we recommend exploring the East section during the day and visiting the West section after 5p when the tourist crowds die down.

programme.title: Animal conservation "a government priority" says United Arab Emirates
programme.desc: Dubai and the United Arab Emirates are making animal conservation a government priority at a time when biodiversity is under threat and more animals face extinction globally. A report by the United Nations earlier this year claimed animal extinctions are at an unprecedented high. According to the organisation, as many as one million species are under threat. On a visit to the desert, you might expect to find camels or antelope, maybe some hawks. But Dubai’s Al Marmoom animal sanctuary is teeming with biodiversity with hundreds of different species of birds, mammals, and reptiles. The sanctuary covers 20 percent of the whole area of Dubai. In the beginning, it was a desert populated by native animals, but as the sanctuary expanded to more than 50 oases, it was discovered these water bodies could control the environmental balance. The sanctuary has even managed to attract the Arabian Oryx. This animal was declared extinct in the wild in 1972, but has now been brought back from the brink by the reserve. Saoud Faisal is a wildlife officer at the Al Marmoom sanctuary. He says in the 80s and 90s the Oryx were overhunted for food. Now the animal is considered part of the regions wildlife. “They are totally protected now and also they are healthy,” he explains. “We have them in large numbers which last year reached more than 500." From desert oases to indoor tropical environments, recent laws in Dubai mean greater governmental support for animal sanctuaries. Laws were introduced in 2007 to cover animal welfare, but awareness really started to build in 2016. The laws also apply to rare and exotic animals. Some are looked after in animal sanctuaries like Green Planet. Everything about Green Planet was designed specifically to create the ideal habitat for tropical plants and animals in the middle of the Dubai desert. The sanctuary houses a wide range of species including many different birds, and mammals such as two-toed sloths. And lizards like green iguanas or basilisks. The latest addition t

programme.title: Best Pizza in Downtown NYC
programme.desc: Looking for the best pizza in NYC? Musician and New Yorker Jesse Malin talks about where to go for the best pizza in downtown Manhattan.

programme.title: Visiting Dubai's many museums
programme.desc: Dubai is home to a multitude of museums, from world-firsts to hidden gems. Quranic Park is one of the citys brand new attractions. About the size of 60 rugby fields, it has been created to give visitors some green space and a better understanding of Islamic beliefs. Inside the park’s orchards and Glass House, visitors can discover a variety of healthy and medicinal flora featured in the Holy Quran, from pomegranates and olives, to figs and garlic. Another attraction at Quranic Park is the Cave of Miracles, where seven miracles recounted in the Holy Quran play out on the walls. "The cave was amazing," says Usman, who is visiting from the UK. "We learnt a lot about the miracles growing up, it just gave another understanding to it. And it was great to visualise it, not just hear about it." "This is an open example that the Quran is not just to read in order to get reward but it is something that can be in practical life," says Anwar, a visitor from the US. "This place is beautiful and a very interesting experience for children. Here, they can actually experience things from the Quran," says Miteab, who lives in Saudi Arabia. Al Shindagha Perfume House From aromatic flora to the UAE’s first museum dedicated to fragrance. The Al Shindagha museum is home to the Perfume House . Part of a complex created to gather, preserve and share Emirati heritage, Perfume House charts the history and role of fragrance in the region. Rashed Almuhairi is Perfume House’s Chief Cultural Guide. “It’s special and important not only for the guests who are coming, he tells Euronews. "It’s for our own generations also. A lot of our youth, they didn’t live in many things like perfuming or pearl diving, so it’s important that they know about our past life. Dubai has a very rich history which needs to be told.” One of the more unusual exhibits on display is a 28 kilogramme piece of oud. Oud is formed in aquilaria trees when they are infected with a particular type of mould. This resinous heartwood is the key ingr

programme.title: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Theres the LA you see in the movies, and then theres the real LA—a gritty, fantastically diverse collection of neighborhoods sprawled between ocean and mountains, each with its own distinct mood. Los Angeles spent years striving to emulate towns like New York or San Francisco, but over the last decade the city took a long hard look in the mirror, dug what it saw, and started focusing on what it does best: casual, multicultural, and effortlessly cool.The new LA is the place everyone suddenly wants to be, where high and low converge on palm-lined sidewalks. The countrys most thriving food scene is here, run by a guerilla band of ethnically diverse chefs cooking up whatever they want, wherever they want, with the best produce in the world. From the industrial warehouses east of downtown to the beachside shopping meccas of Venice, LAs cutting edge street style, art scene, and culinary chops cant be contained—the creative energy pops through the concrete like ficus roots. And just to sweeten the deal, 280-plus days of breezy sunshine form the backdrop of it all. Just dont forget your shades.

programme.title: Hong Kong
programme.desc: From the simple perfection of summer boating, to the daily eruption of energy that is Lan Kwai Fong, Hong Kong has you covered an all things food, drink, entertainment, and lifestyle. The enchanting neighborhoods are coiled with history and culture, each with its own timeline of stories that speak persuasively about Hong Kong’s modernization. Situated against the backdrop of its secret cove-like harbor, the architecture that graces the land is just as extreme. Hong Kong sits atop the throne as the city with the most skyscrapers in the world, yet the urbanized areas are only a fraction of the city itself. The nature that surrounds and pushes through the city, gives Hong Kong it’s true indescribable magic. Denizens know where to find the hiking trails, the views, and escape routes to the open sea. The endless culinary delights, bold experiences, and hidden treasures make Hong Kong a torchbearer of culture, innovation, and lifestyle in Asia.

programme.title: Off the beaten track, Orlando
programme.desc: Out of the many adventures one can have in Orlando, I choose the off the beaten path things to do. My journey begins at the Orlando World Center Marriott, home to the biggest most amazing pool I’ve ever seen. What makes it even more amazing is the fact that mermaid classes are offered through the Mermaid Academy, poolside. The real adventure begins at the Paddling Center at Shingle Creek, which is a quick drive from the hotel. Lined with Cypress trees and the beautiful sounds of nature, it was the perfect setting for a relaxing kayak experience. I end my time in Orlando shopping at Artegon Marketplace. This is mall filled with local artisans who are passionate about their work and products. My highlight was being able to ride on a cute stuffed mechanical animal as I peruse the shops.

programme.title: Namie Osawa
programme.desc: You had me at, "Futuristic robots and sexy Japanese babes fighting off monsters!"We sat down with Namie Osawa, owner and founder of the world famous Robot Restaurant and her team. Namie’s futuristic robot-inspired venue is as visually stimulating as it is entertaining and interactive. She walks us through her inspiration for what now has become a staple experience for locals and global travellers.Interview: NAMIE OSAWA I opened Robot Restaurant three years ago. Even though I was hesitant to show the first concept to foreigners and so forth, I decided to open the restaurant in Kabukicho with the Japanese Businessman in mind. When thinking about what would be appealing to a businessman, I thought about Robots - which I longed for as a kid,..and Girls in sexy costumes. These were the things that initially came to mind. Our rehearsals begin at 11 o’clock in the morning including Wadaiko, which is a Japanese drum dance. We practice for about an hour and thirty minutes, then we have a brief meeting before the show. Rehearsals can be tough, but whatever we go over, ..it’s amazing and we have fun and I think it’s very good. Still, I think that there is a part where not a lot of the content catches on with the audience. Even after repeated viewings, I would like to think that each show was better than the one before it. But on the name alone, people were intrigued and when it arrived, it was beyond the imagination because I wanted it to be a thoughtful experience. Always keep going forward, it’s what we want out of this show. I want to make sure there’s more to it than just a name.

programme.title: What to do in Pompano Beach
programme.desc: One of South Florida’s hidden gems is Pompano Beach, Florida. Located just north of Fort Lauderdale, this quiet beach town is perfect for those who prefer less crowds and a laid back atmosphere. It’s ideal location makes access to other South Florida towns, including Miami, super easy. I start my journey at the Fort Lauderdale Marriott Pompano Beach Resort & Spa. It has the most amazing sunrises which I delighted in each day from my private balcony. The hotel is located directly on the beach which makes it very difficult to leave. I visit the charming beachside town of Lauderdale by the Sea, a 10 minute drive from my hotel. I also take a tour at Butterfly World, the first and largest butterfly house in the United States. It is home over 80 species of butterflies, hummingbird and lorikeet aviaries, and outdoor gardens. This place is truly magical for people of all ages. Pompano Beach is the quintessential beach town. You can truly relax and enjoy the beach at your own pace while indulging as much or as little as you’d like.

programme.title: Adventures – Explore, dive and discover the sealife in Dubai’s waters
programme.desc: An hour and a half away from the city of Dubai, Euronews James OHagan joined the Dubai-based centre Divers Down to complete his PADI training and have his first proper dive. Michela Colella, Operations Manager, Divers Down UAE said, "We will go to an average depth of 14 metres. We’ll look for trumpet fish, triggerfish, clownfish, pufferfish, boxfish." Even with the basic training completed, diving with an instructor helps you feel safer, develop the right habits, and take in all the best spots on the dive site. Some of the most spectacular coral and marine life are located just 5 metres from the surface. At that depth, everything is lit up beautifully and the air lasts much longer than at 10 or 15 metres. The reef has species ranging from stingrays to lobsters, jawfish, parrotfish, broomtail wrasse, and many others. For more experienced divers there are dozens of shipwrecks and artificial reefs to explore each with unique histories and coral formations. At times it feels as if you’re flying in slow motion in some sort of alien landscape. And before you know it, it’s time to come back to the real world. Euronews James OHagan exclaimed, "Oh! That was incredible! Breathtaking!

programme.title: Why visitors are hooked on Dubai Marina, home to luxury yachts, docks, hotels and beach clubs
programme.desc: Whether you see it from the deck of a boat or the wire of its 1km zipline, Dubai Marina is a spectacle of ground-breaking architecture, bespoke superyachts and luxury shoreline hospitality. This sought-after holiday destination encompasses the coastal neighbourhood of Jumeirah Beach Residence, known locally as JBR, home to retail and entertainment developments The Walk and The Beach, which multiple the attractions for fun-seekers. Iconic five-star hotels hug the shoreline, their vast marble lobbies leading to some of Dubai’s most famous weekend brunches and postcard-perfect beaches. Le Méridien Mina Seyahi Beach Resort & Marina is one of the longest-standing hotels in Dubai Marina with 500 metres of private Arabian Gulf coastline providing a playground for water sports enthusiasts. Local expats regularly fill the resort’s Barasti bar, restaurant and beach club. A Dubai institution in its second decade, this well-liked venue has grown into a sprawling sports and beach bar with open-air screenings and food stalls, and the only free-entry beach club in town. Despite progression, Barasti retains its original theme, defined by palm fronds typically found in the traditional barasti shelters favoured by the early Bedouins. Other Dubai Marina beach clubs that draw crowds include Drift to Zero Gravity . Drift is dizzyingly beautiful; its pool deck, a catwalk for the latest swimwear fashions. Open until late, Zero Gravity is known for its high-octane parties and voyeuristic glass-sided pool. Sun worshippers on Dubai Marina’s deep sandy beaches pose for photos that frame its remarkable urban skyline. It’s a backdrop that’s hard to miss, containing some of the tallest residential towers in the world. The 101-storey Princess Tower once claimed the title of the highest, while the Cayan Tower retains its record for the world’s tallest building with a 90-degree twist; it’s structure akin to a giant corkscrew. Flying through the skyscrapers on XLine Dubai is an exhilarating way to experience this brave a

programme.title: Top 5 Things to do in the British Virgin Islands
programme.desc: Teri travels to the British Virgin Islands to explore the top things to do including sailing, diving, island hopping, indulging in spa treatments, and visiting the world famous Baths. Teri later visits the Bomba Shack on Tortola and talks with its legendary owner, Bomba.

programme.title: Tokyo
programme.desc: When you look out your taxi window here, you see life in High-Definition (HD). Tokyo glistens and glows with precision and truly stands in a class of her own. Every street, alley, and crevice lends itself as a gateway to adventures with endless possibilities. A city rooted in heavy history and tradition, but propelled by innovation and imagination, Tokyo has a spellbinding flare for artisan culture, creativity, and design. There is no place like it on Earth, and being home to more Michelin stars than any other place in the world is merely a symbol of Tokyoites devotion to craftsmanship and inventiveness. This city is an endless feast of inspiration - exploring the unknown and finding new paths is highly recommended. Remember to stay humble and behave respectfully, because good manners and thoughtfulness are the real ways to truly experiencing Tokyo and making a few fabulous friends along the way.

Here she encounters sea urchins, sea horses, star fish, pufferfish and more.

programme.title: Beijing
programme.desc: Being the capital of China is a colossal responsibility. With over a billion people watching, Beijing seems to manage the task with dignified ease. The pace of life in this city speaks volumes about its personality and its characters. The mood is steady, confident, and proud. With walls that never end, ducks that bear golden skin, and Forbidden Cities out in the open, Beijing has a storybook magic that can only be found in a megacity overflowing with such rich history and tradition. The landmarks and landscapes are dominant forces, followed by the new developments mounted by modernization. Knowing where to look will be the key to unlocking the cities best adventures and experiences. Don’t be afraid to explore the many interesting nooks and crannies of Beijing’s streets and alleys, as there are many. From the bucket list worthy monuments, to the waves of new restaurants, shops, and cultural encounters available, be sure not to rush. Beijing is a hotbed of commerce and entrepreneurship, and inspires the country’s top artists, students, writers, film-makers, musicians, and creatives to converge within its frontiers. With so much to explore in one of the oldest cities on the planet, traveling somewhere else seems irresponsible - there’s no place like ‘the capital.’

programme.title: Top Ten Things to do in Puerto Rico
programme.desc: Number 10: Go for a hike in El Yunque National park – This is the only subtropical rainforest in the US (besides Hawaii) and is filled with so much bio diversity. Make sure you spot the ylang ylang tree to smell the beautiful flowers used in some of the best perfumes. http://ecotourspuertorico.com/el-yunque-tours-rainforest/ Number 9: Have lunch in La Placita at Chef Jose Enrique’s restaurant. Jose Enrique is an award winning chef who uses his master culinary skills to enrich traditional Puerto Rican dishes. http://www.joseenriquepr.com/ Number 8: Shop in el Mercado in La Placita – Be sure to stop by and talk to Hector Ruiz Housler, who sells herbs and concoctions used to treat all sorts of ailments. Number 7: Have a cafecito at Café Cuatro Sombras - Located in Old San Juan and has the richest, most authentic Puerto Rican coffee in town. http://cuatrosombras.com/ Number 6: Visit Casa Cortés - Indulge your senses in fine chocolate and fine art here. Try their chocolate and cheese snack and sample one of their delicious chocolate beverages. http://www.casacortespr.com/ Number 5: Go to Piñones for authentic Puerto Rican street food – Try the fresh oysters, clams and all of the delicious fried food offered here. Be sure to pass by the cultural center to learn the history of this important Puerto Rican neighborhood. Number 4: Spend an afternoon in the Botanical Gardens – Take a tour and smell the cinnamon and bay rum trees and if you’re lucky, you just might spot a coqui. http://sanjuanpuertorico.com/san-juan-botanical-garden-jardin-botanico-universidad-de-puerto-rico/ Number 3: Stay on Condado Beach. I love the San Juan Marriott Resort and Casino. It’s a quick drive from the airport, has breathtaking views, and has amazing service. http://www.marriott.com/hotels/travel/sjupr-san-juan-marriott-resort-and-stellaris-casino/ Number 2: Have a Bioluminescence experience - Puerto Rico has three Bioluminescent bays which contain millions of micro-organisms, called “dinoflagellates”, that glow fluorescent in the dark when agi

programme.title: Scopa Italian Roots
programme.desc: Scopas airplane hangar-like space in Venice is dominated by a 50-foot bar, communal high-tops, booming acoustics, and a jovial crowd at happy hour. The resulting vibe can only be described as surprisingly pleasant chaos. Bartenders are yelling out NEGRONI orders, servers are dancing around tables to drop Italian cold-cut platters, and diners are leaning in to converse over piles of handmade noodles.About those noodles: Top Chef vet Antonia Lofaso cooks upscale Italian with no fuss, like RIGATONI with vodka sauce and more modern takes like CRESTE RIGATE with morels and English peas. She smears nutty ricotta on ciabatta crostini and then leaves it rightly un-messed-with except for some quality olive oil and fresh parsley. The DEEP-FRIED FLUFFERNUTTER for dessert reminds you that life—and perhaps cardiac health—shouldnt be taken too seriously.

programme.title: Dubai acts to stem the tide of single use plastic
programme.desc: Dubai’s airports have banned all single use plastics as the city works towards a plastic-free future. It comes as the attitude towards single use plastics is changing. In Dubai, 90 per cent of people say they are making a conscious effort to reduce their own plastic waste consumption. Nearly four in five say they recycle more now than they did five years ago. And one in four people say theyre encouraged to recycle more by corporations championing plastic-free initiatives. Dubai International Airport along with Dubai World Central welcome almost 90 million passengers each year. But with those passengers comes 5,500 tonnes of plastic. The airports’ operator, Dubai Airports, banned all single use plastics from inside the terminal at the beginning of this year. That means that plastic cutlery, water bottles, drinking straws, packaging and polythene bags are all banned from cafes and restaurants. Eugene Barry, Dubai Airports’ executive vice president (commercial), told Focus: “Ninety five per cent of our partners have actually made the pledge to switch from plastic to appropriate and relevant substitutes for some of the products that are used in catering and retail across the airport.” The operator hopes its a strategy that might become a template for other major transportation hubs and businesses. “This is very much the early stages of a long journey, I believe, to have a more environmentally friendly approach to managing businesses,” Barry said. Dubai’s 700 hotels are already looking at alternatives, such as switching water bottles from plastic to glass. Plastic key cards could also be a thing of the past, as developers look into switching them to wood-based materials. The eco packaging company Avani is one firm offering plastic-free alternatives, including a bag made from cassava, a cheap and common root vegetable. programme.title: Craziest Things You Can Do on a Cruise

programme.title: Manulife President CEO Roy Gori Shares His Strategy to Navigate the New Normal
programme.desc: In this episode of "From the Corner Office," Black Enterprise President and CEO Earl "Butch" Graves, Jr., has an insightful conversation with Manulife President and CEO Roy Gori on what the future workforce might look like once the Covid-19 pandemic is over.

programme.title: Behind the Scenes in Hollywood with Women Power Brokers
programme.desc: On this edition of Women of Power, we go behind the scenes with directors, show runners and an actress making moves in Hollywood. We lead off with Mara Brock Akil, the hot creator behind some of TVs most exciting shows like "Girlfriends" and "Being Mary Jane." She shares her journey from journalism school to being a hit Hollywood producer. Then, we sit down with Academy Award nominee Ava Duvernay, who is emerging as a directorial force behind one of last years most-talked about movies, "Selma." From there, we talk to Tonya Lewis Lee, who is stepping out of the shadows of her husband, Spike Lee, and into her own light as a producer and best-selling author. And finally, we get survival tips from Lorraine Toussaint, an actress whos career has spanned more than 30 years.

programme.title: Capitalizing the Community
programme.desc: Michelle Johnson is the co-founder of plant-based milk Ghost Town Oats, which has raised more than $230,000 in a community round of financing

programme.title: DeVon Franklin Remakes the Classic Musical Annie
programme.desc: We sit down with DeVon Franklin, the former Sony Executive and CEO of Franklin Entertainment, who is the powerhouse behind the new remake of the classic musical “Annie.” He tells of his journey from an intern with Will Smith’s company, to becoming one of Hollywood’s most bankable producers. Then, we profile Tammy Williams, Founder & CEO of Open Rivers Pictures. We later speak to Tom Castro, Founder & CEO of El Dorado Capital. And finally, we spotlight a film by Alex Ford, a sophomore at Princeton University.

programme.title: Prioritizing Mental Health at Work
programme.desc: Therapy for Black Girls’ Dr. Joy Harden Bradford shares how Black women can cultivate mental wellness – even in difficult workplaces

programme.title: Mind. Body. Spirit. How Black Men Can Survive Trauma and Thrive
programme.desc: Hear from some of today’s most trusted and celebrated voices in the areas of criminal justice reform, mental health, and education. We will discuss the multigenerational trauma experienced by black men through a broken prison system, police profiling, systematic inequalities in access to education, and the cumulative psychological effects caused by these and other stresses. We’ll explore what we can do to help black men not only survive but conquer adversity and thrive. Join us as we unpack the issues, explore potential solutions, and identify where we go from here.

programme.title: Check Yourself Body Language Boot Camp Workshop II

Lessons learned from the 2020 Black Enterprise Women of Power Summit.

programme.title: Spontaneous Human Combustion: Natural Phenomenon or Flaming Fiction?
programme.desc: Spontaneous human combustion: Human bodies suddenly bursting into flame without any apparent heat source. This television program examines whether spontaneous human combustion is physically possible or is it nothing more than an urban legend.

programme.title: Dolphins: Stray Noises or Intelligent Communication?
programme.desc: Dolphins are regarded as one of Earth's most intelligent animals and capable of sending information to each other. This program studies their intellectual similarities to humans and asks: Do dolphins have the capacity to understand human communication?

programme.title: Fast Zombies with Guns
programme.desc: Collateral Damage. Sometimes, it’s unavoidable. Mobster Kingpin Paul Varlo’s (Charles Ramsey) attempt to kill a potential rat by poisoning his personal water supply leads to something he never saw coming – an outbreak of zombie carnage! To make matters worse, these zombies are different; they’re faster, meaner and they’re armed…With the town being overrun by fast zombies with guns, one resilient band of people are left to attempt an escape to the nearest undead-free zone and survival.Meanwhile, Jake (Tony Swansey) and his girlfriend Laura (Leena Kurishingal) are cruising their way up to this sweet, little Midwestern town. One quick business transaction with the local mob boss, and they can continue on their way to some fun in the sun, as planned. However, what they discover is a deserted town … at first.Will the group survive the terror that has befallen them? Will Jake and Laura get their money?? Will the zombies run out of bullets??? The answers can be found in … Fast Zombies with Guns.

programme.title: Secret Societies and Sacred Stones: from Mecca to Megaliths
programme.desc: For millennia mankind has worshipped stones, from Mecca to Megaliths we have held them aloft as sacred objects and gifts from the gods. The worship of sacred stones constitutes the most ancient form of religion. From the origin of ritualized worship in Sumeria and Egypt to Secret Societies such as the Knights Templar and the Illuminati, ancient stones have been been idolized and used in secret and magical ceremonies unknown to the outside world. They have been placed at the very center of religious icons, used to take power over the souls of others and have been fashioned into beautiful gems and artifacts and yet, the stones remain a mystery. But why? What is the secret in the stones? In this unique film we uncover the secrets of the stones with a group of experts including Egyptologist, Ahmed Osman, Metallurgist, Robert Feather, UFO expert, Nick Pope, TV presenter on the esoteric, Franky Ma, filmmaker, Zachary Miller and New York Times best selling author of mysteries, Patrice Chaplin. This special team were brought together for the motion picture, The Stone, and this fascinating documentary reveals the story behind the film and it's meaning. Produced by mystery writer, Andrew Gough and Directed by Writer & Director of The Stone, Philip Gardiner, this special DVD features unseen footage from the movie, music and loads of special features. Prepare to enter a magical realm of secrets and mystery.

programme.title: Carnivolution: Satan's Playthings
programme.desc: Carnivolution is the Squidling Brothers Circus Sideshow's adventures through space, time, and inter-dimensional pockets. Launched into space with a rocket full of trash, Matterz Squidling and Jelly Boy the Clown are beamed aboard the Nipple Ship of the Madoodi Mothers intergalactic variety show. Pursued by villains, Alpha Mouse McDonald and Mr. Commercial, the group crash lands on planet Menstrualia. Found guilty of treason by Queen Menstrualia, the Squidlings and Madoodis are sent on a quest to find the big ass particle smasher and recreate the big bang on a miniature scale. Overwhelmed by their villainous foes, the circus sideshow is sent to another dimension, Zombie Zoo Zay, the place where the fire goes when it becomes extinct. A realm of ass-faced religious fanatics that leads them to hell and back again. All along being used as Satan's Playthings. Witness the strange powers of sword swallowing, fire arts, the bed of nails, and so much more!

programme.title: The Island With Bear Grylls S01 E03 NB
programme.desc: Bear Grylls is abandoning 13 ordinary British men on a remote, uninhabited island in the pacific. Can they survive for a month completely alone? When stripped of all the luxuries and conveniences of 21st century living, does modern British man still have the spirit and skills to survive? The men are dropped off by Bear, and they are left totally alone with the clothes they stand up in and a few basic tools. In danger of being overwhelmed by the tides they battle through the dense undergrowth and the enormity of the task ahead quickly dawns on them.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay’s Great Escape S01 E01 - India Part 1 NB
programme.desc: Gordon’s odyssey begins in the north, home of our curry house classics. On board an express train he’s thrown in at the deep end and experiences a back-to-basics baptism of fire, cooking for its many passengers in the train’s cramped pantry car and getting travel sick while he’s making curry. In stark contrast he then meets his match working for a cantankerous royal chef, preparing a biryani with a difference for a huge wedding feast before venturing into the jungle where he gets eaten alive by ants when he scales a 40-foot tree in search of the local tribe’s favourite delicacy. Then it’s on to Delhi to cook at the restaurant that invented tandoori chicken, where Gordon puts into practice everything he’s learnt for a tough crowd of Delhi food critics.

programme.title: Paradise Kitchen Bali S01 E05 Coconut
programme.desc: Explore the boundless potential of coconuts with Lauren as she reinvents a calamari dish using coconut flesh, offering a taste experience that will leave you in awe and redefine your culinary perceptions.

programme.title: The Napa Valley - A Journey through America's Wine Country
programme.desc: The Napa Valley" features the spectacular landscape photography of Olof & Elizabeth Carmel paired with beautiful piano and guitar instrumentals. It features the seasons of the Napa Valley, from spring wildflowers and blossoms through the rich colors of autumn in the vineyards.

programme.title: Grand Canyon Vistas - Updated!
programme.desc: Experience exhilarating views from the south rim of the Grand Canyon paired with a beautiful soundtrack in this 3 hour video, remastered for more vibrant viewing experience!

programme.title: The Rise of Charity Witt
programme.desc: S1:E5 Dubbed The Worlds Strongest Barbie, Charity suffered a heart attack when she was only 17 years old, due to being overworked and poor life choices. This health crisis lead her to change her mindset by taking action on changing her life, that put her on a path that lead her to becoming an elite powerlifter, a Strongwoman competitor, a winner of the Titan Games and escaping an abusive relationship.

programme.title: The Rise of Wim Hof
programme.desc: S1:E1 The Iceman (Wim Hof), a man seemingly immune to freezing temperatures, who once climbed Mount Everest only in his shorts and shoes sounds like a fictional superhero. But Wim isn’t invincible to pain, in fact, the opposite. The worst tragedy he’s suffered was the catalyst that inspired him to master his mind and body and help millions do the same.

programme.title: The Rise Of Damien Rider
programme.desc: S1:E7 Damien Rider was beaten up, thrown against walls, and left all by himself as a child because of an abusive stepfather. After four attempts to end his own life, he decided he needed to deal with his demons by doing the most extreme thing he could do. Discover why Damien felt like he needed to paddle through a deadly ocean and why when he was just about to quit, the entire trajectory of his life would be permanently changed forever.

programme.title: The Rise of Wim Hof
programme.desc: S1:E1 The Iceman (Wim Hof), a man seemingly immune to freezing temperatures, who once climbed Mount Everest only in his shorts and shoes sounds like a fictional superhero. But Wim isn’t invincible to pain, in fact, the opposite. The worst tragedy he’s suffered was the catalyst that inspired him to master his mind and body and help millions do the same.

programme.title: Winona Ryder vs. Johnny Depp
programme.desc: S1: E10 Johnny Depp’s trial with Amber Heard had everyone talking, but wait until you hear about Winona Ryder’s. Johnny experienced love at first sight and became obsessed with Winona. But after their breakup, Winona dealt with mental health issues and her own very public trial, which has some striking similarities with Johnny and Ambers. Everyone thought she was a crazy, and the aftermath of her court case left her banished from the world. Winona went through a great awakening outside of the public eye and bounced back into Hollywood.

programme.title: Cameron Vs. Justin & Jessica
programme.desc: S1:E13 Cameron Diaz was one of the biggest stars in the world. So why did she leave it all behind? Our team uncovers a link between Cameron’s explosive breakup with Justin Timberlake and her choice to leave acting behind. It all ties back to one question, did Justin cheat on Cameron?Justin sparked cheating rumors when he moved on from Cameron 4 days later with Jessica Biel. Our team gets to the truth behind those rumors to reveal the role Justin played in Cameron disappearing and the truth is even more shocking…

programme.title: Nicole Kidman vs. Tom Cruise
programme.desc: S1:E9 Was Scientology the reason why Tom Cruise divorced Nicole Kidman? Nicole was obsessed with Tom. She tried to do everything she could to be with the superstar at all times. But Tom had another obsession: Scientology. Then, when Tom Cruise suddenly divorced Nicole, the world she thought she was living in shattered into a million pieces. Was it because of Scientology? Was it the multiple miscarriages she had? Was it the wiretap Tom allegedly put on Nicole? This story was so uncovered, that our team had to dig deep to get the details.

programme.title: Anna Faris vs. Chris Pratt
programme.desc: S1:E6 If Chris Pratt didn’t have an affair with Jennifer Lawrence, why did he file for divorce From Anna Faris? Chris Pratt and Anna Faris were the famous, ideal couple the world couldn’t get enough of. But when Chris Pratt skyrocketed into superstardom, Anna felt more and more insecure. Then, rumors of Chris having an affair with co-star Jennifer Lawrence emerged. Even though they both deny having an affair, Chris and Annas sudden divorce, fallout of their personal lives, and the health of their son caused a media frenzy that our team got to the bottom of.

programme.title: Katy Perry vs. Russell Brand
programme.desc: S1:E7 Katy Perry is no stranger to toxic relationships. She finally thought she landed the perfect one with bad boy comedian Russell Brand, only for him to divorce her through text message right in the middle of her world tour 2 years later. Our team uncovered the full story of the turbulent aftermath and the journey she went on to become a strong, authentic person who was finally able to fully embrace a healthy relationship.

programme.title: Vengeance For A Voiceless Child
programme.desc: 8 year old Jennifer wakes up in the middle of the night in the arms of a police officer. The man wants her to believe that she is safe, but she realizes he doesnt have a badge as he drives off to a remote area. Later that night, her kidnapper leaves her for dead in the middle of a field after brutally attacking her, and from that moment on, Jennifer vows to remember every single detail about him in order to make sure he’s caught. Her injuries leave her unable to talk, yet she still finds a way to catch him… 19 years later.

programme.title: Terry Crews My Biggest Regret
programme.desc: For years Terry Crews was terrified of his alcoholic father. Decades later, Terry finally confronts him about his childhood. But why does it become his biggest regret?

programme.title: Mike Tyson The Baddest Man On The Planet
programme.desc: Mike Tyson was called the “baddest man on earth;” but outside the ring, family tragedy & childhood trauma were causing him to spiral out of control. Learn how Tyson found discovered what it really means to be a winner.

programme.title: Escaping North Korea The Search for Freedom
programme.desc: Yeonmi Park was deprived of her childhood and forced to grow up far too quickly in horrifying circumstances under the tyrannical regime of KIM JONG-UN. When she was smuggled out of North Korea she hoped to find freedom and a better life, but things only got worse. This is her story.

programme.title: Lauren Wasser The Model With Golden Legs
programme.desc: Lauren Wasser was thriving as a young fashion model, but her life quickly took a dramatic turn when she fell victim to Toxic Shock Syndrome. What started as a normal day for Lauren ended with her being found on the bedroom floor just 10 minutes away from losing her life. Luckily, Lauren survived but was tragically forced to lose both her legs. It seemed like her fashion career was over. But instead, the unthinkable happened.

programme.title: Vengeance For A Voiceless Child
programme.desc: 8 year old Jennifer wakes up in the middle of the night in the arms of a police officer. The man wants her to believe that she is safe, but she realizes he doesnt have a badge as he drives off to a remote area. Later that night, her kidnapper leaves her for dead in the middle of a field after brutally attacking her, and from that moment on, Jennifer vows to remember every single detail about him in order to make sure he’s caught. Her injuries leave her unable to talk, yet she still finds a way to catch him… 19 years later.

programme.title: Kevin Berthia The Golden Gate Bridge Guardian Angel
programme.desc: Kevin Berthia tells the true story of how the power of listening and hope saved him from the darkest moment of his life on the Golden Gate Bridge.

programme.title: Life After Genocide
programme.desc: A survivor of war, Clemantine Wamariya was just 6 years old when she ran for her life during the Rwandan genocide. For 12 years, Clemantine and her sister Claire searched for their family, but it seemed all hope was lost... Until they received a shocking family letter that cracked their hearts wide open. What happened? And why did Clemantine want everyone to know her name?

programme.title: Ultimate Freedom March Remembering John Lewis
programme.desc: This short documentary is a tribute to the memory of civil rights leader John Lewis, his relationship with Martin Luther King Jr. and the courage he showed in fighting for an ideal, for freedom, democracy and justice. There is a moment in everyones life when our hearts are pounding and we are inspired and motivated to be the hero of our story. Step forward and go for what you believe in.

programme.title: Win Against all Odds
programme.desc: Homesick, bankrupt, and father-less, young Dan Lok was devastated when he arrived home one day to find his mom in tears. His riveting coming-of-age story will inspire you to put your best foot forward every single day.

programme.title: 10x Your Life
programme.desc: Author, entrepreneur, and sales savant, Grant Cardone, breaks down the power of his 10X Rule and how you can use it to multiply your success.

programme.title: This 10 Medicare Plan Will Save You THOUSANDS
programme.desc: Ever heard about the $10 Medicare plan that could save you a fortune? Marvin Musick from Medicare School gives you an in-depth understanding of its four essential components, with a special spotlight on THIS Part D plan! Imagine facing staggering medication costs; with Part D, those fears are a thing of the past. Marvin explains the unique four-phase structure of Part D and showcases its potential to offer substantial savings on treatments for conditions like diabetes and heart disease. As you are turning 65 and researching the BEST plans for this Annual Enrollment Period, tune in, and learn just how $10 can be your shield against unexpected medical costs!

programme.title: Episode 2 How does a group plan work with Medicare

programme.title: Mini s Bold Move The New Countryman Redefines Compact

This episode dives into the shift from pure electric vehicles (EVs) to hybrids, highlighting how Ford and Volvo are recalibrating their electric aspirations in favor of hybrid powertrains that combine the best of both worlds."

programme.title: Working While Receiving Social Security Here s What You Need to Know

But what happens if you continue working while collecting Social Security benefits? This topic can be confusing, and misinformation abounds

programme.title: Annuity vs Lump Sum-Which Pension Option Is Better

programme.title: Best and Worst Ages to Take Social Security Benefits

programme.title: 7 Things medicare will never cover

programme.title: Bitcoin Jesus: The Prosecution of Roger Ver
programme.desc: They call him “Bitcoin Jesus,” though he despises the nickname. His real name is Roger Ver. At any moment, Roger could be arrested for alleged tax evasion and mail fraud. But anyone familiar with his case knows the truth: Roger’s only “crime” was being the very first investor and passionate advocate for Bitcoin. For that, he faces 109 years in federal prison. As devastating as this is for Roger, this case is less about him and more about you.
